channel.title: Notes on Jared Baron Panares

item.title: Cyber Relics: Cyberstart America
item.description: Anecdote CyberStart was one of the few opportunities available for high schoolers that put a focus more on learning rather than competition (it had both though). What made it different from programs such as HackTheBox were the chances to get a certification at the end of yearly program, with some criteria completed of course. From what I can recall, courses and exam attempts for at minimum the GSEC, GFACT, GCIH, and a cloud certification that I can’t remember were available.
